column4: im having a ridiculous time with lib64 stuff... I need libs such as libglx.a and stuff to compile the nvidia driver...
um, why are you trying to 'compile the nvidia driver'?
update xorg to 6.8.1-1ubuntu9 (been available for a few hours); reinstalling the nvidia driver won't fix it
the nvidia installer will do weird things with amd64, because it has been designed for red hat, which does amd64 differently
do I need hoary to use xorg?
just change source.lst to hoary? or would it be a lot better to install hoary first?
note that hoary is not recommended if you're not familiar with how to fix breakages
it would just be a horror to build two versions
so Im just stuck with the older kernel? that sucks
so my only hope is that newer nvidia kernels thus ubuntu packages will fix the problem ?
yeah.  apparently breaking older cards is a 'known issue' upstream, and they'll fix it in their next driver revision.
Im not even using an older card! nvidia is driver crazy or something
the joys of binary drivers, eh?
i think the biggest breakages were on tnt2, geforce2, and geforce4 mx440
